description: A clear description of what this feature accomplishes and why it's being built

userStories.title: Example: Add login form component
userStories.description: Create a login form with email and password fields that validates input on submit
acceptanceCriteria: Password input field with type='password' and min 8 chars
Shows inline error for invalid email format
userStories.notes: Use existing Button and Input components from @/components/ui. Follow React Hook Form patterns already in codebase.

userStories.title: Example: Add login server action
userStories.description: Create server action to handle login form submission, validate credentials, and create session
acceptanceCriteria: Server action in app/auth/actions.ts (Next.js) or api/auth.ts (Vite/CRA)
Validates email format and password length server-side
Returns typed success or error response
userStories.notes: Follow existing server action patterns. Use bcrypt for password comparison. Return error codes, not raw error messages.

userStories.title: Example: Connect form to server action
userStories.description: Wire up the login form to call the server action and handle loading/error states
acceptanceCriteria: Form calls login server action on submit
Shows loading spinner during submission (disable form)
Displays error message from action response
E2E test covering full user flow
userStories.notes: Use useTransition for loading state (Next.js) or useState (Vite/CRA). Handle network errors gracefully.
